name: 1-(3-methoxybenzoyl)-2-(1-naphthoyl)hydrazine
Reason: 1-(3-methoxybenzoyl)-2-(1-naphthoyl)hydrazine has a complex structure with multiple functional groups that affect its melting point. The basic unit for comparison can be benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The methoxybenzoyl group (–O–C(=O)–) adds approximately +20°C due to increased molecular weight and rigidity. The naphthoyl group (–C1=CC=CC=C1–) adds approximately +30°C due to increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces. The hydrazine group (–NH2–) can form hydrogen bonds, which may lower the melting point by approximately +10°C. The carbonyl group (–C(=O)–) can also form hydrogen bonds, which may lower the melting point by approximately +5°C. The methoxy group (–O–) can increase the melting point by approximately +5°C due to increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces.
